text:
“Stupid Love” is a song recorded by American singer Lady Gaga. It was released as the lead single from her sixth studio album, "Chromatica", known to her fans as “LG6”. The song was officially released on February 28, 2020, although it was leaked online a few weeks earlier. Gaga wrote the song with well-known pop songwriter Max Martin, Ely Rise, and its producers, BloodPop and Tchami.
Reviewers have said that the song marked a return to dance-pop for Gaga, after she released "Joanne" in 2016, which contained country influences. Writing for "The Atlantic", Spencer Kornhaber called “Stupid Love” “a glorious comeback,” “irrepressible,” and “fantastic.” Dan Adler from "Vanity Fair" said that the song “suggests a return to the thunderous high-concept anthems that shaped Gaga’s initial rise.”
The song entered the Australian ARIA Chart at number seven and the UK and US charts at number five.
